description.narrative: New Element,which contributes to Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 adolescent girls, women of childbearing age (especially pregnant and breastfeeding women) and their children aged 0-59 months adopt better nutrition practices and use quality nutrition-specific and sensitive services.

mailing-address.narrative: Immeuble des Nations Unies - Koulouba 01 BP 3420 - Ouagadougou 01

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Care for children with severe acute malnutrition
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for SAM and nutrition in emergencies
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received IYCF counselling and messages through facility, community outreach, social media and other communication channels with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Number of children 6-59 months admitted for treatment of severe acute malnutrition (SAM) [COVIDSitRep]
In humanitarian situations: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received IYCF counselling
In humanitarian situations: Number of children aged 6-59 months with SAM who are admitted for treatment
